member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that compiler support for a particular feature is required for the location where this attribute is applied.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.IsOptional
member.summary: If true, the compiler can choose to allow access to the location where this attribute is applied if it does not understand .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.RefStructs
member.summary: The used for the ref structs C# feature.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.RequiredMembers
member.summary: The used for the required members C# feature.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiredMemberAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type has required members or that a member is required.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallerArgumentExpressionAttribute
member.summary: Tags parameter that should be filled with specific caller name.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallerArgumentExpressionAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Function parameter to take the name from.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallerArgumentExpressionAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets name of the function parameter that name should be taken from.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.SkipLocalsInitAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that the .locals init flag should not be set in method headers.
member.remarks: This attribute is unsafe because it may reveal uninitialized memory to the application in certain instances (e.g., reading from uninitialized stackalloc'd memory). If applied to a method directly, the attribute applies to that method and all nested functions (lambdas, local functions) below it. If applied to a type or module, it applies to all methods nested inside. This attribute is intentionally not permitted on assemblies. Use at the module level instead to apply to multiple type declarations.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be .

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that certain members on a specified are accessed dynamically, for example through .
member.remarks:
This allows tools to understand which members are being accessed during the execution of a program.
This attribute is valid on members whose type is or .
When this attribute is applied to a location of type , the assumption is that the string represents a fully qualified type name.
When this attribute is applied to a class, interface, or struct, the members specified can be accessed dynamically on instances returned from calling on instances of that class, interface, or struct.
If the attribute is applied to a method it's treated as a special case and it implies the attribute should be applied to the "this" parameter of the method. As such the attribute should only be used on instance methods of types assignable to System.Type (or string, but no methods will use it there).

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified member types.
member.param: The types of members dynamically accessed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute.MemberTypes
member.summary: Gets the which specifies the type of members dynamically accessed.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes
member.summary:
Specifies the types of members that are dynamically accessed.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute
member.summary: States a dependency that one member has on another.
member.remarks: This can be used to inform tooling of a dependency that is otherwise not evident purely from metadata and IL, for example a member relied on via reflection.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified signature of a member on the same type as the consumer.
member.param: The signature of the member depended on.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified signature of a member on a .

The containing .

The full name of the type containing the specified member.
The assembly name of the type containing the specified member.

member.param: The types of members depended on.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.MemberSignature
member.summary: Gets the signature of the member depended on.
member.remarks: Either must be a valid string or must not equal , but not both.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.MemberTypes
member.summary: Gets the which specifies the type of members depended on.
member.remarks: Either must be a valid string or must not equal , but not both.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.Type
member.summary: Gets the containing the specified member.
member.remarks: If neither nor are specified, the type of the consumer is assumed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.TypeName
member.summary: Gets the full name of the type containing the specified member.
member.remarks: If neither nor are specified, the type of the consumer is assumed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.AssemblyName
member.summary: Gets the assembly name of the specified type.
member.remarks: is only valid when is specified.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.Condition
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition in which the dependency is applicable, e.g. "DEBUG".

member.summary: /// Indicates that the specified member requires assembly files to be on disk.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A message that contains information about the need for assembly files to be on disk.

member.summary: Gets an optional message that contains information about the need for assembly files to be on disk.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresAssemblyFilesAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the member, why it requires assembly files to be on disk, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method requires the ability to generate new code at runtime, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when compiling ahead of time.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires dynamic code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute
member.summary: /// Indicates that the specified method requires dynamic access to code that is not referenced statically, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when removing unreferenced code from an application.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of unreferenced code.

member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of unreferenced code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires unreferenced code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute
member.summary: /// Suppresses reporting of a specific rule violation, allowing multiple suppressions on a single code artifact.
member.remarks: is different than in that it doesn't have a . So it is always preserved in the compiled assembly.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the category of the tool and the identifier for an analysis rule.
member.param: The category for the attribute.
The identifier of the analysis rule the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Category
member.summary: Gets the category identifying the classification of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property describes the tool or tool analysis category for which a message suppression attribute applies.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.CheckId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the analysis tool rule to be suppressed.
member.remarks: Concatenated together, the and properties form a unique check identifier.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the scope of the code that is relevant for the attribute.
member.remarks: The Scope property is an optional argument that specifies the metadata scope for which the attribute is relevant.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets a fully qualified path that represents the target of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument identifying the analysis target of the attribute. An example value is "System.IO.Stream.ctor():System.Void". Because it is fully qualified, it can be long, particularly for targets such as parameters. The analysis tool user interface should be capable of automatically formatting the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument expanding on exclusion criteria.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument that specifies additional exclusion where the literal metadata target is not sufficiently precise. For example, the cannot be applied within a method, and it may be desirable to suppress a violation against a statement in the method that will give a rule violation, but not against all statements in the method.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Justification
member.summary: Gets or sets the justification for suppressing the code analysis message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Shared.DiagnosticIds.DiagnosticIds
member.summary: Various diagnostic IDs reported by this repo.
member.remarks: When adding a new diagnostic ID, add a corresponding suppression to the root Directory.Build.targets file, and add a documentation entry to docs/list-of-diagnostics.md.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Shared.DiagnosticIds.DiagnosticIds.Experiments
member.summary: Experiments supported by this repo.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Shared.Diagnostics.Throw

member.remarks: The main purpose is to reduce code size, improve performance, and standardize exception messages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.Empty
member.summary: Defines static methods used to optimize the use of empty collections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.Empty.ReadOnlyCollection``1
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty collection.
member.returns: Returns an efficient static instance of an empty collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.Empty.Enumerable``1
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty collection.
member.returns: Returns an efficient static instance of an empty collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.Empty.ReadOnlyList``1
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty collection.
member.returns: Returns an efficient static instance of an empty list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.Empty.ReadOnlyDictionary``2
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty dictionary.
member.typeparam: The key type of the dictionary.
The value type of the dictionary.
member.returns: Returns an efficient static instance of an empty dictionary.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.EmptyCollectionExtensions
member.summary: Defines static methods used to optimize the use of empty collections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.EmptyCollectionExtensions.EmptyIfNull``1(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{``0})
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty collection if the input is or empty, otherwise returns the input.
member.param: The collection to check for or empty.
member.returns: Returns a static instance of an empty type if the input collection is or empty, otherwise the collection.
member.remarks: Substituting a static collection whenever an empty collection is needed helps in two ways. First, it allows the original empty collection to be garbage collected, freeing memory. Second, the empty collection that is returned is optimized to not allocated memory whenever the collection is enumerated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.EmptyCollectionExtensions.EmptyIfNull``1(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{``0})
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty collection if the input is or empty, otherwise returns the input.
member.param: The collection to check for or empty.
member.returns: Returns a static instance of an empty type if the input collection is or empty, otherwise the collection.
member.remarks: Substituting a static collection whenever an empty collection is needed helps in two ways. First, it allows the original empty collection to be garbage collected, freeing memory. Second, the empty collection that is returned is optimized to not allocated memory whenever the collection is enumerated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.EmptyCollectionExtensions.EmptyIfNull``1(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{``0})
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty collection if the input is or empty, otherwise returns the input.
member.param: The collection to check for or empty.
member.returns: Returns a static instance of an empty type if the input collection is or empty, otherwise the collection.
member.remarks: Substituting a static collection whenever an empty collection is needed helps in two ways. First, it allows the original empty collection to be garbage collected, freeing memory. Second, the empty collection that is returned is optimized to not allocated memory whenever the collection is enumerated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.EmptyCollectionExtensions.EmptyIfNull``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0})
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty list if the input is or empty, otherwise returns the input.
member.param: The list to check for or empty.
member.returns: Returns a static instance of an empty type if the input collection is or empty, otherwise the collection.
member.remarks: Substituting a static list whenever an empty collection is needed helps in two ways. First, it allows the original empty collection to be garbage collected, freeing memory. Second, the empty collection that is returned is optimized to not allocated memory whenever the collection is enumerated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.EmptyCollectionExtensions.EmptyIfNull``1(``0[])
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty array if the input is or empty, otherwise returns the input.
member.param: The array to check for or empty.
member.returns: Returns a static instance of an empty array if the input array is or empty, otherwise the array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.EmptyCollectionExtensions.EmptyIfNull``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty collection if the input is or can be determined to be empty, otherwise returns the input.
member.param: The collection to check for or empty.
member.returns: Returns a static instance of an empty type if the input collection is or empty, otherwise the collection.
member.remarks: This method does not enumerate the collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Shared.Collections.EmptyCollectionExtensions.EmptyIfNull``2(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns an optimized empty dictionary if the input is or can be determined to be empty, otherwise returns the input.
member.typeparam: The key type of the dictionary.
The value type of the dictionary.
member.param: The dictionary to check for or empty.
member.returns: Returns a static instance of an empty type if the input dictionary is or empty, otherwise the dictionary.
member.remarks: Note that this method does not enumerate the dictionary.
